content: On August 24, 1996, the Atlanta Braves faced the San Diego Padres in a thrilling matchup at Turner Field. Tom Glavine delivered a stellar performance, pitching a complete game and leading the Braves to a 3-1 victory. This win was part of the Bravesâ€™ remarkable season that ultimately culminated in their fourth consecutive division title, showcasing Glavine's dominance on the mound during the team's run of success in the 1990s.
